benchmark_details.name: Russian Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs (RuBLiMP)
benchmark_details.overview: RuBLiMP is a benchmark consisting of 45 datasets, each including 1k minimal pairs that differ in grammaticality and isolate a linguistic phenomenon, covering various morphological, syntactic, and semantic aspects specific to Russian. It utilizes open text corpora and expert-written perturbation rules to generate these pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the grammatical knowledge of language models through minimal pairs that isolate specific linguistic phenomena in Russian.

data.source: Sentences extracted from open text corpora including Wikipedia and Russian literature, annotated and perturbed to create minimal pairs.
data.annotation: Manual curation and validation by linguists

methodology.calculation: Accuracy measured through comparison of model performance on generated minimal pairs.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better performance by models in identifying grammatical contrasts.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance averages around 95% accuracy on RuBLiMP.
methodology.validation: Validated by 20 native speakers with linguistics backgrounds
